intro: Hypecoum imberbe, commonly known as the naked bladder nut, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows up to 2 meters tall, featuring woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces striking red or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and the plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Hypecoum imberbe is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
